title: Manuel Medina-Mora Expands His Role and Is Appointed Chief Executive Officer for Global Consumer Banking
summary: Miami, Florida - Citi announced that Manuel Medina-Mora has expanded his role and was appointed CEO Global Consumer and Commercial Banking. This appointment aims at better positioning Citi to consolidate its sustainable growth.
tag-1: Manuel Medina-Mora Expands His Role and Is Appointed Chief Executive Officer for Global Consumer Banking
tag-3: Miami, Florida – Citi announced that Manuel Medina-Mora has expanded his role and was appointed CEO Global Consumer and Commercial Banking. This appointment aims at better positioning Citi to consolidate its sustainable growth.
tag-4: The objective of Medina-Mora's appointment, a Mexican who has climbed the highest in the finance sector globally, is to ensure the strategy of Consumer Banking is implemented consistently on a global scale, while capitalizing on individual market opportunities around the globe. As the new CEO for Global Consumer and Commercial Banking, Manuel Medina-Mora will continue to report to CEO Vikram Pandit.
tag-5: "Mobility and challenging new assignments for our people are at the core of Citi's history and key strengths of any well managed business, especially one with our global footprint. To this end, several of our top business leaders will soon be moving into new roles across all of our operating regions as we continue to execute our strategy," said CEO Vikram Pandit. "As the new consumer strategy yields results, we need to ensure its implementation is consistent on a global basis while capitalizing on individual market opportunities."
tag-6: In addition to his new role as CEO of Global Consumer and Commercial Banking, Manuel Medina-Mora will maintain his oversight over Citi Latin America and Mexico, and remains a member of the Citi Latin America Executive Committee. Two new CEOs were appointed: Javier Arrigunaga for Mexico and Francisco Aristeguieta for Latin America. Both CEOs continue reporting directly to Medina-Mora.
tag-7: Arrigunaga has a long and distinguished career in the financial services industry and has been with Banamex since 2002. He has served in a variety of roles in Mexico, including Head of Investment Management and more recently as Head of ICG. Previously, he spent 12 years at Mexico's central bank, and then he was appointed Head of the Deposit Insurance Fund, the agency responsible for managing the 1995 Mexican banking crisis. He also served as Mexico's Ambassador to the OECD.
tag-8: Francisco joined the company 17 years ago in Venezuela as Vice President and Senior Relationship Manager for the Corporate Bank. He rose through several positions in Venezuela, including Head of the Corporate Bank, Financial Institutions and the Public Sector. He has also served as CCO for Ecuador and CEO of the Andean region. Currently, he is Head of GTS for Latin America.
tag-9: These important changes will become effective January 1, 2012.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
